page.title: 02APPERKNOWLE VILLAGE
page.content: Apperknowle is a small village that overlooks the valley of the River Drone. The road up to Apperknowle from the valley bottom enters the village as a 1 in 7 hill. The village grew last century with the opening of the coal mines. These were only small mines and didn't remain productive for very long. The coal was transported down the hillside by private rail track to the main railway along the valley bottom. All of the miners' terraced cottages have now been demolished and new council houses take their place. Many of the other dwellings are old cottages and private bungalows. There is a population of about 573. The village has a green that has recently been developed on the site of former houses. New trees have been planted.
